verses.kjv: Ephraim feedeth on wind, and followeth after the east wind: he daily increaseth lies and desolation; and they do make a covenant with the Assyrians, and oil is carried into Egypt.
verses.ct: Ephraim chases the wind and pursues the scorching east wind. Every day they pile up more lies and destruction. They make treaties with Assyria while sending olive oil to Egypt.

verses.kjv: The LORD hath also a controversy with Judah, and will punish Jacob according to his ways; according to his doings will he recompense him.
verses.ct: The LORD also has a case against Judah, and he will punish Jacob for his conduct. He will repay him based on what he has done.

verses.kjv: He took his brother by the heel in the womb, and by his strength he had power with God:
verses.ct: In the womb, Jacob grabbed his brother's heel, and when he grew strong, he wrestled with God.

verses.kjv: Yea, he had power over the angel, and prevailed: he wept, and made supplication unto him: he found him in Bethel, and there he spake with us;
verses.ct: He struggled with the angel and won. He wept and pleaded with him. God met him at Bethel, and there he spoke with us —

verses.kjv: Even the LORD God of hosts; the LORD is his memorial.
verses.ct: the LORD God of Armies. The LORD is the name by which he is remembered.

verses.kjv: Therefore turn thou to thy God: keep mercy and judgment, and wait on thy God continually.
verses.ct: So return to your God. Practice loyal love and justice, and always put your hope in your God.

verses.kjv: He is a merchant, the balances of deceit are in his hand: he loveth to oppress.
verses.ct: Ephraim is like a dishonest merchant holding rigged scales in his hands — he loves to cheat people.

verses.kjv: And Ephraim said, Yet I am become rich, I have found me out substance: in all my labours they shall find none iniquity in me that were sin.
verses.ct: Ephraim says, 'I've gotten rich! I've built up my wealth! With everything I've earned, no one can find any sin or wrongdoing in me.'

verses.kjv: And I that am the LORD thy God from the land of Egypt will yet make thee to dwell in tabernacles, as in the days of the solemn feast.
verses.ct: But I am the LORD your God since the time you were in Egypt. I will make you live in tents again, just like during the days of the appointed festival.

verses.kjv: I have also spoken by the prophets, and I have multiplied visions, and used similitudes, by the ministry of the prophets.
verses.ct: I spoke through the prophets, gave them many visions, and communicated through parables by means of the prophets.

verses.kjv: Is there iniquity in Gilead? surely they are vanity: they sacrifice bullocks in Gilgal; yea, their altars are as heaps in the furrows of the fields.
verses.ct: Is Gilead full of wickedness? Absolutely — they are worthless! They sacrifice bulls in Gilgal, and their altars are as numerous as stone piles scattered across plowed fields.

verses.kjv: And Jacob fled into the country of Syria, and Israel served for a wife, and for a wife he kept sheep.
verses.ct: Jacob fled to the land of Aram. There Israel worked to earn a wife, and for a wife he tended sheep.

verses.kjv: And by a prophet the LORD brought Israel out of Egypt, and by a prophet was he preserved.
verses.ct: Through a prophet, the LORD brought Israel up out of Egypt, and through a prophet, Israel was protected.

verses.kjv: Ephraim provoked him to anger most bitterly: therefore shall he leave his blood upon him, and his reproach shall his LORD return unto him.
verses.ct: Ephraim has provoked the LORD to bitter anger. So the Lord will leave the guilt of his bloodshed on him and will pay him back for his disgrace.
